title: Wooyong (Tommy) Park
text:
Undergraduate student School of Economics, Yonsei University Personal Email(Main): tommypark822@gmail.com Institution Email: 161823@yonsei.ac.kr

CV

title: Favorite Books
text:
Currently I’m reading The Personal MBA, written by Josh Kaufman.
4 of my favorite books are

Siddhartha (by Herman Hesse)
Crime and Punishment (by Fyodor Dostoevksy)
Man’s Search for Meaning (by Victor Frankl)
Demian (by Herman Hesse)

title: Slides and Materials
text:
Applied Microeconomics Reading Group, Yonsei University

Introduction to Nationwide Panel Datasets(PSID, KLIPS, CNEF)
Social Media and Mental Health(Braghieri et al., 2022)



Applied Economic Methods Study Group, Yonsei University
I started out this study group in January(2024) with students in the Economics department who aim for attaining PhD in Applied Economics. We are planning to have this study group every vacation between semesters, and pass on the materials and resources to future students as well. I gave presentations on topics such as clustering standard errors and staggered difference-in-differences. 

Cluster Robust Standard Errors
Staggered Difference-in-Differences I
Staggered Difference-in-Differences II(R)
Staggered Difference-in-Differences II(Stata) 



Junior Scholar Club, Yonsei University

Social Connectedness and Information Markets(Kranton and McAdams, 2024)



Elsewhere

Data Summary: KLIPS(Korean Labor Institute Panel Study)(KOR)
Data Summary: PSID(Panel Study of Income Dynamics)
Economics for Highschool Students(KOR)  → Here I visited my alma mater and introduced DiD and IV to highschool students.

section: Applied Economic Methods Study Group, Yonsei University
text:
Applied Economic Methods Study Group, Yonsei University
I started out this study group in January(2024) with students in the Economics department who aim for attaining PhD in Applied Economics. We are planning to have this study group every vacation between semesters, and pass on the materials and resources to future students as well. I gave presentations on topics such as clustering standard errors and staggered difference-in-differences.
